hackathon-description-text: nwHacks is the biggest 24 hours hackathon in Western Canada hosted at the University of British Columbia. This hackathon aims to bring together the brightest talents from schools around the Pacific Northwest region. Get ready for a weekend of learning and discoveries!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Sponsored by Cockroach Labs. Prize: $1000 CAD

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Novel Usage of Mojio's Platform

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Sponsored by CA Technologies. Prizes include:
Sponsored by Microsoft. Winning team receives Raspberry Pis and Surface Arc Touch Mice.
Sponsored by RBC. Winners to pitch their idea to Highline Beta (a startup co-creation company that launches new ventures) + VISA gift cards + some swag!
hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Most Innovative Use of Data and Open-Source Big Data Technologies

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Use your tech skills for good and hack online harassment! Build a software solution that can help reduce the frequency and/or severity of online harassment. Members of the winning team receive Hack Harassment Battery Packs!

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Sponsored by Clio. Best accessibility hack gets $500 in Apple Store gift cards!

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=2350 Health Sciences Mall, Vancouver, BC V6T, Canada

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Is the hack technically interesting or difficult? Were there real technical challenges to surmount?
Is the project unique and creative? When someone sees the project, will they think "WOW this is cool"?
Is the hack usable in its current state? Is the user experience smooth? Does everything appear to work? Is it well-designed?
Is there a problem that the hack solves? If so, how useful is it?

hackathon-location-address: 2350 Health Sciences Mall, Vancouver, BC V6T, Canada
hackathon-location-description: University of British Columbia - Life Sciences Centre
